channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: The head of St Andrew's Cathedral School, Dr John Collier, advises aspiring teachers to follow their hearts and to specialise at university.
item.title: Teaching has been a lifelong vocation for this headmaster

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Australia records lowest number of COVID-19 cases in 24-hour period since early March, US death toll passes 46,000, Australia's death toll stands at 76

item.dc:creator: Adam Carey
item.description: Secondary schools are still waiting for guidance on how to handle crucial assessments for year 12 students who are being taught remotely.
item.title: Schools left in dark about how to proceed with year 12 assessments

item.dc:creator: Darren Gray
item.description: Listed online auto classifieds company moves to cut costs as some dealers report a 40-60 per cent drop in new car sales in April.
item.title: Carsales.com cuts staff as COVID-19 deflates auto sales

item.dc:creator: Dana McCauley
item.description: Australia's borders look set to remain closed for months, as the Morrison government weighs a proposal to open up travel to and from New Zealand.
item.title: Borders to remain closed for months, government weighs NZ travel

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: Coronavirus-induced market volatility has wiped $30b in funds from AMP's wealth, capital and banking arms.
item.title: Market mayhem whacks $30b hole in AMP's funds under management

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: The economic cost of coronavirus lockdowns is well known, but the Queensland government today tried to address the mental toll of the pandemic on residents.
item.title: Queensland addresses mental toll of pandemic restrictions

item.dc:creator: Fran Rimrod
item.description: The WA government has unveiled $154.5 million in relief for landlords, businesses and employees in the construction industry impacted by the COVID-19 pandemic.
item.title: WA coronavirus LIVE: $154.5 million cash splash to keep WA apprentices employed and tenants in their homes

item.dc:creator: Nick Toscano
item.description: Santos, one of the nation's largest energy producers, is bracing for a heavy hit when the drastic oil price crash flows through to sales.
item.title: Santos braces for heavy hit as oil price tumbles 'into the teens'

item.dc:creator: Nicole Pedersen-McKinnon
item.description: For the banks, a payment holiday means some short-term pain for longer-term gain. It's the opposite for borrowers, who mostly will pay more.
item.title: Three cheaper alternatives than taking a mortgage holiday

item.dc:creator: The Herald's View
item.description: If we keep our cool, Australia can emerge in a few months with the disease under control.
item.title: COVID-19 is on the ropes but it could still fight back

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Corovirus LIVE Queensland updates: Lowest daily tally of new COVID-19 cases in a 24-hour period

item.dc:creator: Angus Thompson
item.description: A disqualified building certifier unwittingly had his credentials used to justify the opening of the Marsden Hotel in Burwood.
item.title: Deluxe hotel's vital documents forged, court finds

item.dc:creator: Alexandra Smith
item.description: The NSW government is looking to ban Nazi flags after a swastika was flown on a Newtown house on the weekend.
item.title: 'Symbols of hatred': NSW seeks to ban Nazi flags

item.dc:creator: Jewel Topsfield
item.description: The holiest month in the Islamic calendar, which starts on Friday, will be both no different and yet profoundly different in the shadow of the global pandemic.
item.title: Feasting or fasting, this year brings a Ramadan like never before

item.description: Everything you need to know to pick a winner on an eight-race card at Port Macquarie.
item.title: Race-by-race tips and preview for Port Macquarie on Friday

item.dc:creator: Hamish Hastie
item.description: The biggest of the packages announced was $100 million for land tax relief grants to be paid to commercial landlords freezing outgoings and providing at least three months rent relief to small business tenants.
item.title: WA government offers to pay rent for struggling households and land tax for landlords

item.dc:creator: Cameron Houston
item.description: The driver of a black Porsche involved in the horrific Eastern Freeway crash that killed four police officers has been identified by multiple police sources as mortgage broker Richard Pusey.
item.title: Driver of Porsche involved in freeway crash identified as Melbourne mortgage broker

item.dc:creator: Rob Harris
item.description: This year's Anzac Day commemorations will be markedly different, with the nation's 14,000 remaining WW2 veterans staying at home due to the coronavirus.
item.title: Just 14,000 who signed up to fight Hitler left standing 75 years on

item.dc:creator: Michael Fowler
item.description: With the lockdown making sales of badges impossible this year, RSL Victoria is struggling to raise funds that support veterans and their families.
item.title: Anzac Appeal raises just 3% of target as street sales take a tumble

item.dc:creator: Jordan Baker
item.description: Education Minister Sarah Mitchell says the union's proposal to return year 12 to school first forgets that every child's education should be equally valued.
item.title: Premier accuses teachers' union of wanting kids home indefinitely

item.dc:creator: Tom Cowie
item.description: Victoria's COVID-19 rate of infection has slowed to a trickle, with the state reporting just one new case, providing hope the feared peak has passed.
item.title: 'Very promising': Victoria keeps brake on COVID-19 infection rate

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: A fourth resident has died after testing positive for COVID-19 at Newmarch House aged care facility near Penrith.
item.title: 'Terrible situation': fourth death as nursing home struggles with staffing

item.dc:creator: Linda Morris
item.description: Last call for grant money for creatives doing it tough during the coronavirus shutdown.
item.title: Last call for council arts grants to lift creatives and culture

item.dc:creator: Chris Zappone
item.description: The campaign appears to have picked up steam around mid-March with Mandarin-language Twitter accounts designed to mimic and harass Western media.
item.title: Pro-China trolls fake accounts to hound foreign media over coronavirus

item.dc:creator: Charlotte Grieve
item.description: $3.8 billion is set to be withdrawn from the superannuation industry in the first week since the government's early access to super scheme opened.
item.title: 456,000 Australians approved to access superannuation early

item.description: The "startling" revelation is contained in a Corruption and Crime Commission report into misconduct risks in the Office of the Auditor-General.
item.title: WA cops personal details put at risk: CCC

item.dc:creator: Georgina Mitchell
item.description: Mario Henry Aliverti assaulted nine children between 1985 and 2007.
item.title: Former Scout leader jailed for 31 years for decades of child sex abuse

item.dc:creator: Anna Patty
item.description: But a Woolworths staff member who is also in the army will not work and will stand in the driveway of her home with a candle to remember the friends she had lost at war.
item.title: Supermarkets to open on Anzac Day morning for the first time

item.dc:creator: Lauren Pilat
item.description: Despite state government issued guidelines for schools to offer both face-to-face and remote learning from term 2, private schools have taken their own approach.
item.title: Private schools not providing face-to-face learning should reduce fees: Premier

item.dc:creator: Phil Lutton
item.description: Roger Federer has been supported in his desire to merge the ATP and WTA Tours but not everyone is fully convinced, including Australia's Nick Kyrgios.
item.title: Kyrgios not on board with Federer's vision of merged tennis tour

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: Only 10 of Brisbane's 25 planned backburns were completed in 2019.
item.title: Brisbane backburn under way as bushfire memories flicker

item.dc:creator: Rachel Eddie
item.description: Month-old dashcam footage has surfaced a speeding black Porsche, believed to be the same vehicle involved the deadly Eastern Freeway crash that killed four Victorian police officers.
item.title: 'Like a Formula 1 car went by': Footage emerges of speeding black Porsche

item.dc:creator: Colin Kruger
item.description: While its Malaysian operations remain closed due to the coronavirus, rare earths group Lynas scored a significant win with a US Defence contract.
item.title: Lynas gets a boost from US Defence contract

item.dc:creator: Tim Barlass
item.description: He vividly recalled the flash from the tests being so bright he could see the bones of his hands through closed eyes and sunglasses
item.title: RAAF career went from Tiger Moths to atomic testing

item.dc:creator: Bianca Hall
item.description: It's a rare thing in the arts community to get good news at the moment, so when she opened her emails musican Emily Ulman burst into tears.
item.title: Musicians and crews get a lifeline after music festival cancelled

item.description: But the greatest discovery is one I never thought I’d be able to bear: accepting the generosity of others.
item.title: Having to live frugally has helped me appreciate the little things in life that matter

item.description: Gallery: The best photos from around the world
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: Sarah Danckert
item.description: Queensland has hit back at an attempt by Melbourne Airport to lure Virgin to the city
item.title: 'Absolutely ridiculous': Queensland Premier hits back at Melbourne's Virgin pitch

item.dc:creator: Kerrie O'Brien
item.description: In a new series, The Age is asking prominent Victorian artists and leaders to talk about their favourite local works. This week, Charlotte Day, director of Monash University Museum of Art, has nominated Callum Morton’s 'Hotel' on EastLink.
item.title: Callum Morton's remarkable Hotel on EastLink

item.description: England bowler Chris Woakes says cricketers would agree to be quarantined together in one location if it means they will be allowed to play matches.
item.title: Chris Woakes open to quarantine for a cricket restart

item.dc:creator: Wayne Carey
item.description: Once we get back playing again it will be blatantly obvious who has put in the work and who hasn’t.
item.title: Nowhere to hide when footy returns for players who don't do the work

item.dc:creator: Rachel Clun
item.description: Two people part of a cluster linked to a western Sydney aged care facility were also among five new cases in NSW.
item.title: Nurse, paramedic latest of almost 60 healthcare workers diagnosed with COVID-19 in NSW

item.dc:creator: Erin Pearson
item.description: The four police officers killed in the horrific Eastern Freeway crash have been named, with the Chief Commissioner vowing to uncover "every detail" that led to the tragedy.
item.title: 'You were an absolute joy': Tributes for police officers killed in horror crash

item.dc:creator: Chris Roots
item.description: Royal Celebration has run into a handful of black-type performers in his career and gets his chance to join them in Saturday's Hawkesbury Cup.
item.title: Second no more: Royal Celebration chases hat-trick in Hawkesbury Cup

item.dc:creator: Shane Wright
item.description: Tammy's wage bill will double under JobKeeper as many of her part time employees get a pay rise. Covering the bill with no income will depend on the bank.
item.title: JobKeeper wage system pushing small businesses to the edge

item.dc:creator: Jane Hume
item.description: This is an opportunity for all super funds to demonstrate their commitment to their members at a time when they need it most.
item.title: Super withdrawals a necessary trade-off for many

item.dc:creator: Lucy Cormack
item.description: It is alleged the men tried to pick up Joe Elias by his hands and feet and carry him into their Toyota Hilux, however he managed to escape.
item.title: Two charged over alleged attempt to kidnap Sydney party boat operator for ransom

item.dc:creator: Tory Maguire
item.description: Senior political correspondent David Crowe joins Tory Maguire to discuss how the government will keep up with the demand for the JobKeeper and JobSeeker subsidy programs.
item.title: Please Explain podcast: Business rushes to JobKeeper

item.description: Smoke from the bushfires that ravaged Australia in December and January continues to circle the globe almost four months after it was formed.
item.title: Australian bushfire smoke plume still drifting around the world
